sub_title: Team Lead DNA laboratory | Sr (research) project manager | Molecular biological process engineer
summary:
AMBITION
Life Science is my passion, especially when I can contribute significantly to product and / or process innovations that have a clear positive impact on human life.
* Talent? Getting from research to implementation.
* Industry? Nowadays with ambition in the business of soil/crop health, after having served the animal industry. My drive is equally big in human research (i.e. healthcare/ sports).
* Approach? Clear project management, achieving goals by inspiring/ creation of team spirit.
* Businesses? Those that like me like to act decisively, whether in new research, and/ or in (industrial) processing.

PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS
Top Sport mentality (don't quit to easily), dedicated, independent thinking, thoughtful decisive, organizer, precise, analytical, net-worker.

SKILLS
Project management, molecular and reproductive biology, various process technologies, (q)PCR, ISO, validation, QC, fertility, cryopreservation, genomics, life science, cloning, sequencing, DNA, flow cytometry/ FACS, imaging and separation techniques, applied statistics, 

...On a very different note, something I also did: Adventure Speaker/ Fundraiser....{YouTube]

projects.title: GFP gene optimized (for expression studies)
projects.description: Improved the GFP (Green Fluorescent Protein) by mutation, such that the protein content fluoresces much better than the wild type. This resulted in a patent as GFP is an important reporter gene for in vivo expression studies.

contributors.headline: Team Lead DNA laboratory | Sr (research) project manager | Molecular biological process engineer

projects.title: Cryopreservation
projects.description: Responsible for the execution of various projects within CRV (together with Wageningen University), to improve cryopreservation techniques. This has led to increased sperm survival rates and more efficient lab processing.

contributors.headline: Team Lead DNA laboratory | Sr (research) project manager | Molecular biological process engineer
Ph D at Universidade dos Açores

projects.title: Fertility research
projects.description:
Participated / supervised several projects to improve male / female fertility of cattle. New insights / improvements (see publications) were achieved through optimization AI dosages, improved cryopreservation of bovine semen, detection of new genes related to fertility (eg
within the EU project SABRE).

contributors.headline: Team Lead DNA laboratory | Sr (research) project manager | Molecular biological process engineer
Business Operations Manager at Wageningen Bioveterinary Research

projects.title: Flow cytometry - FACS
projects.description:
Responsible for various research projects:
* Contributed in validation, optimization and commercialisation of a major breakthrough animal reporduction technique (since IVF): the separation of male and female sperm.
* Development/ implementation quality tests, based on membrane integrity of bull semen.

contributors.headline: Team Lead DNA laboratory | Sr (research) project manager | Molecular biological process engineer

projects.title: Food - Nutrition
projects.description:
Various studies and resulting project proposals achieved (independently or delegated to experts), i.e.:
* Milk, the effect of A1/A2 ß-caseïne on the development of type-1 diabetes.
* The effect of nutrition on prepuberal development of animals.

contributors.headline: Team Lead DNA laboratory | Sr (research) project manager | Molecular biological process engineer

projects.title: Quality control (development tests)
projects.description: Managed several research projects to improve bovine semen quality measurements in the laboratory. This has resulted in new insights (see publications) on morphology, DNA damage, membrane structures and movement characteristics. A number of results have contributed to predict better fertility/ quality of semen.

contributors.headline: Team Lead DNA laboratory | Sr (research) project manager | Molecular biological process engineer

projects.title: Standardization laboraties (worldwide)
projects.description: Managed several projects to support the ongoing standardization/ ISO certification process of CRV laboratories wordwide. This has resulted in new improved protocols, equipment, etc. for these laboratories.

projects.title: Cloning disease resistance genes (agricultural crops)
projects.description:
Managed several projects, i.e.:
* Jan 98 - Jul 00, successful introduction of the Mi-1 gene in heterologous plant systems (to obtain new nematode-resistant crops), enabling to study the role of the Mi-1 gene in plant signal transduction. As a spin-off new techniques at KeyGene were introduced (such as the "Agrobacterium transient transformation assay" and the "yeast-two-hybrid system").
* May 95 - Dec 97, substantially contributed to the isolation of the Mlo mildew-resistance gene from barley, using BACs (Bacterial Artificial Chromosomes).

contributors.headline: Team Lead DNA laboratory | Sr (research) project manager | Molecular biological process engineer
Consultant Molecular Diagnostics

projects.title: Construction genomic libraries
projects.description:
Several BAC libraries were constructed succesfully, in which the genomes of various agricultural crops were cloned in large DNA fragments:
* lettuce (project with Prof. Dr.. RWM Michelmore, see publication)
* barley (project with Prof. P. Schulze-Lefert)
* tomato (project by Taco Jesse)

contributors.headline: Team Lead DNA laboratory | Sr (research) project manager | Molecular biological process engineer
Researcher Next Generation Sequencing at Rijk Zwaan Breeding B.V.

projects.title: PCR
projects.description:
Contributed within a research team to develop AFLP (Amplified Fragment Length
Polymorphism) and cDNA-AFLP, new techniques that made it possible to DNA / RNA 'fingerprint' each kind of organism, regardless of the complexity of the genome.

profile_positions.title: Specialist Molecular Biology

profile_positions.description:
To raise awareness (through lectures, etc.), and funds for this foundation.

ALS (Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis) is one of the most serious aggressive terminal muscle diseases. The average life expectancy after diagnosis is 3 years. Little is known what causes ALS. The foundation is there to raise awareness, initiate more research, and better quality of care for patients.

I raise funds for this foundation since 2007. First during my participation in the Tour d'Afrique, an extreme bicycle race of 95 stages across Africa (from Cairo to Cape Town). Then as 'Adventure Speaker', in which I have entertained many groups with unique footage about this most beautiful, but also most challenging expedition (www.stichting-als.nl, www.adriefrijters.nl).
profile_positions.title: Fundraiser | Adventure speaker

profile_positions.title: Freelance research project manager | Consultant (fertility) research

profile_positions.description:
Extensive project management experience: 20 + (research) projects initiated/ completed with "positive" evaluation by the client (s) in the field of genomics/ reproduction/ nuttrition cattle. Substantial achieved improvements? See 'projects' below for a selection.

Key Responsibilities:
* directing project members, from academics/ bachelors (1-10) to field staff (300+)
* setting up and maintain partnerships/ networks (universities/ laboratories worldwide)
* processing/ separation techniques (development, optimization, validation, implementation including groundbreaking new technologies)
* quality control/ research (development, optimization, validation, implementation of new tests, such as: DNA damage, membrane intactness, binding assays using techniques like flow cytometry, microscopy, imaging)
* standardize laboratories worldwide
* support ISO certification (set up quality monitoring systems)
* data processing/ applied statistics
* setting up new project proposals and convert into project plans, analyses-interpretation of results,  intermediate and final reports
* (scientific) publishing, presentation, meeting techniques
* preparing yearly plans and vision documents
* contract negotiations
* grant/ patent applications, IP
profile_positions.title: Senior research project manager

profile_positions.description:
As Researcher the first 2,5y i.a. responsible for implementation and further optimization of the so-called BAC (bacterial artificial chromosome) technology, to facilitate the isolaton of interesting genes from crops. I was the first who introduced this new technique in Europe from the U.S., which has led to the isolation of important disease resistance genes from eg barley, lettuce and tomato.

As Project Manager the last 2,5y responsible for four molecular biological research projects (budget > 9000 hours) regarding disease resistance genes in plants, which led to a variety of publications, and patent applications. 

Key Responsibilities:
* directing project teams (1-10 members)
* analysis-interpretation of research results/ writing (progress)reports for stakeholders
* (scientific) publishing/ presenting
* support patent applications (one accepted)
profile_positions.title: Researcher | Research project manager

profile_positions.description: First as a MSc student then as coworker, succesfully set up, executed and completed a significant research project in which the entire genome of lettuce was cloned for the first time as large DNA fragments in Escherichia coli, to enable the isolation of interesting disease resistance genes. For this the so-called BAC-technology was used.
profile_positions.title: MSc student | Researcher

profile_positions.description: Successfully contributed in the development of, in that time, very innovative laboratory techniques (the so-called "AFLP, multiplex AFLP and cDNA-AFLP fingerprint "techniques), and applying these for accelerated breeding of agricultural crops.
